excerpt: City views spread from this hilltop, 9th-century Muslim castle with a history museum & guided tours.
detail_description: Perched on a hilltop, Castell de Santa Bàrbara is a 9th-century Muslim castle offering guided tours and housing a history museum. The journey to the castle takes you through the charming streets of El Barrio Santa Cruz, an old neighborhood with colorful Mediterranean tiles and potted flowers. The castle's dramatic position overlooks Alicante, where it has played a significant role in the city's history since its founding.
name: Castillo de Santa Bárbara
address: 03002 Alacant, Alicante, Spain

excerpt: Large museum with a modern interior, offering permanent & temporary exhibitions of 20th-century art.
detail_description: MACA Contemporary Art Museum of Alicante, also known as the Museo de Arte Contemporaneo de Alicante, is a prominent municipal museum located in the Asegurada building, which is the oldest civil building in Alicante. The museum boasts a diverse collection of 20th-century and contemporary art, featuring around 800 art pieces.
name: MACA Contemporary Art Museum of Alicante
address: Pl. Sta. María, 3, 03002 Alacant, Alicante, Spain

excerpt: Permanent & temporary exhibitions about field, urban & underwater archaeology, with local finds.
detail_description: The Archaeological Museum of Alicante, housed in the old San Juan de Dios Hospital, is a cultural gem showcasing over 80,000 artifacts that vividly depict the diverse civilizations that have influenced the region. The museum offers a blend of permanent and temporary exhibitions focusing on field, urban, and underwater archaeology. What sets this museum apart is its modern approach to presenting archaeological findings using cutting-edge technology. It's not just about traditional showcases; there are interactive activities and videos explaining archaeological methods.
name: Archaeological Museum of Alicante
address: Pl. Dr. Gómez Ulla, S/N, 03013 Alacant, Alicante, Spain

excerpt: Sprawling, urban sand beach for swimming & sunbathing with a bi-level promenade, palm trees & cafes.
detail_description: Playa del Postiguet is a stunning urban beach located at the base of Mount Benacantil and near the iconic Santa Barbara Castle in Alicante. This 900-meter-long beach boasts fine golden sand, crystal-clear waters, and a bi-level promenade lined with palm trees and cafes. It's a perfect spot for swimming, sunbathing, and enjoying breathtaking views of the Mediterranean Sea.
name: Playa del Postiguet
address: Spain

detail_description: MERCADO CENTRAL, also known as Mercat Central, is a sprawling public market located in the historic district of Valencia. It offers an extensive array of local produce, meats, seafood, breads and more. Exploring this vibrant marketplace provides a fascinating glimpse into the diverse crops and foods cultivated in Valencia.
name: MERCADO CENTRAL
address: C. Cándida Jimeno Gargallo, 4, 03001 Alicante, Spain

excerpt: Scenic stretch of white sand with hotels, restaurants & bars, plus beach volleyball & water sports.
detail_description: San Juan Playa is a renowned beach destination located in Alicante, offering a picturesque stretch of white sand lined with hotels, restaurants, and bars. The area is bustling with activity year-round and serves as a hub for tourists due to its proximity to other towns like Santa Pola, Torrevieja, Altea, and Denia. Visitors can also explore natural treasures in the region and enjoy the numerous golf courses along the Alicante coast.
name: San Juan Playa
address: Alicante, Spain

excerpt: Alicante is a port city on Spain’s southeastern Costa Blanca, and the capital of the Alicante province. Its old town, Barrio de la Santa Cruz, has narrow streets, colored houses and a nightlife scene. From here, an elevator or a steep climb leads to medieval Castillo de Santa Bárbara, set on a hilltop with sweeping views of the Mediterranean coast.
detail_description: Alicante, a vibrant port city on Spain's Costa Blanca, boasts a charming old town with narrow streets and colorful houses. The medieval Castillo de Santa Bárbara offers stunning views of the Mediterranean coast. The city is known for its diverse culinary scene, offering everything from traditional rice and fish dishes to gourmet cuisine and casual fare. Alicante is emerging as a culinary hotspot, with an abundance of tapas bars and upscale dining options.
name: Alicante
address: Spain

detail_description: The Rellotge de Sol de la Basilica de Santa Maria is a historic church in Alicante, Spain, which was constructed on the site of a former mosque following the city's reconquest from the Moors in the 13th century. Situated near the coastal area of Alicante, this basilica features intriguing marks on its facade that are believed to be remnants of war-related damage.
name: Rellotge de Sol de la Basilica de Santa Maria
address: Pl. Paseíto Ramiro, 5, 03002 Alacant, Alicante, Spain

excerpt: Contemporary museum dedicated to competitive sailing equipment, history & general information.
detail_description: Nestled in the vibrant marina of Alicante, Museo The Ocean Race stands as a contemporary tribute to the thrilling world of competitive sailing. This unique museum offers an immersive experience for visitors, featuring interactive installations that delve into the rich history and challenges faced by sailors in ocean racing. With captivating displays showcasing historic photographs, videos, and boat models, guests can embark on a journey through time while learning about legendary sailors and their daring adventures at sea.
name: Museo The Ocean Race
address: Mlle. Levante, 10, 03001 Alacant, Alicante, Spain

detail_description: The Port of Alicante has a rich history dating back to the fifth century BC, when it was a primitive wharf for Iberian people. The bay's natural protection from strong winds made it desirable to various civilizations including the Romans, Moors, and Christians. Visitors can explore nearby archaeological sites like Tossal de les Basses and enjoy guided tours that include attractions such as the Castle of Santa Barbara, Archaeological Museum, and the vibrant Bonfires of San Juan festival.
name: Port of Alicante
address: Spain

excerpt: Museum housing medieval to modern Spanish art, set in a splendid, 18th-century palace.
detail_description: Located in a magnificent 18th-century palace, the Gravina Museum of Fine Arts (MUBAG) in Alicante is a must-visit for art enthusiasts and history buffs. Boasting an extensive collection dating back to the 16th century, this museum showcases Spanish art from medieval to modern times. With over 500 art pieces on display, including portraits of Ferdinand VII and sculptures by Francisco Salzillo, MUBAG offers a comprehensive journey through the evolution of art.
name: Gravina Museum of Fine Arts MUBAG
address: Carrer Gravina, 13, 15, 03002 Alacant, Alicante, Spain

excerpt: Seaside recreational park offering a lake with boats, a BMX track, trails, waterfalls & palm trees.
detail_description: Parc El Palmeral is a stunning recreational park located just outside the city center of Alicante. It offers a variety of activities for families and visitors, including boat rides on the lake, BMX track, walking trails, and beautiful palm trees. The park features numerous play areas for children, picnic spots with benches and tables, as well as lush green spaces to relax in.
name: Parc El Palmerar
address: Avinguda d'Elx, 109, 03008 Alacant, Alicante, Spain

excerpt: Residential mansion & local landmark built in a beaux arts–inspired style between 1922 & 1925.
detail_description: Casa Carbonell is a historic mansion and local landmark located in Alicante, Spain. This iconic building was constructed between 1922 and 1925 in a beaux arts–inspired style by architect Juan Vidal Ramos for a wealthy local entrepreneur, Enrique Carbonell. The mansion features intricate stonework, ornate balconies, and elaborate facades, making it one of the city's most distinctive buildings.
name: Casa Carbonell
address: Passeig Esplanada d'Espanya, 1, 03002 Alacant, Alicante, Spain

detail_description: Alicante City Hall is a stunning Baroque building designed by Lorenzo Chapuli in the 18th century. Despite enduring conflicts like the War of Succession and the Civil War, it has retained its elegant charm. The main floor houses a sculpture by Salvador Dali, while the main staircase features a sea-level mark known as Cota Cero, against which all other altitudes in Spain are measured.
name: Alicante City Hall
address: Plaça de l'Ajuntament, 1, 03002 Alacant, Alicante, Spain

excerpt: Large hill overlooking Alicante, with city views & the remains of a medieval fortress at the summit.
detail_description: Mount Benacantil is a large hill in Alicante, offering stunning views of the city and featuring the remains of a medieval fortress at its summit. The fortress, known as Santa Barbara castle, has a rich history influenced by Phoenicians, Greeks, Romans, and Arabs. From its walls, visitors can enjoy panoramic views of the city and the surrounding coastal and inland areas. The old walled city was built at the foot of this fortress.
name: Mount Benacantil
address: 03002 Alicante, Spain

excerpt: This 16th-century Catholic basilica features gothic Valencian style & an ornate baroque entryway.
detail_description: The Basilica of St Mary of Alicante is a 16th-century Catholic basilica known for its gothic Valencian style and ornate baroque entryway. This prominent religious landmark in the heart of the city boasts stunning Baroque architecture, rich artistic heritage, elaborate sculptures, altarpieces, and beautiful stained glass windows. The basilica holds cultural significance and is a must-visit for tourists exploring Alicante's legacy.
name: Basilica of St Mary of Alicante
address: Pl. Sta. María, 1, 03001 Alacant, Alicante, Spain

detail_description: Mirador de la Santa Cruz, situated at the top of the Santa Cruz area in Alicante, offers breathtaking views of the city and the Concatedral de San Nicolas. The walk up to this vantage point is rewarded with a stunning panorama that includes 18th-century manor houses, quaint chapels, and various urban monuments. Despite concerns about gentrification impacting its charm, visitors can still enjoy leisurely strolls through this unique neighborhood while taking in the picturesque scenery on foot.
name: Mirador de la Santa Cruz
address: 5, C. Diputado Auset, 27, 03002 Alicante, Spain

excerpt: Streamlined rooms with shared bathrooms in an unfussy guesthouse offering complimentary Wi-Fi.
detail_description: Old Town Alicante B&B is an adult-only guesthouse located in the heart of the city, offering streamlined rooms with shared bathrooms and complimentary Wi-Fi. The B&B is housed in a traditional home turned bed and breakfast, featuring beautifully decorated rooms with a mix of contemporary and antique interiors.
name: Old Town Alicante B&B
address: C. Pintor Cabrera, 15, 1º izquierda, 03003 Alicante, Spain

detail_description: The Central Market Steps in Alicante is a must-visit for food enthusiasts. One of the highlights is Vicente Leal's stall, where you can find a coastal specialty called salazones, which dates back to the Phoenicians. These are various cuts of oily fish that are cured to create flavorful and nutritious ingredients.
name: Central Market Steps - Alicante meeting point
address: Av. Alfonso El Sabio, 10, 03004 Alicante, Spain

detail_description: "Homenaje a las Hogueras de San Juan" is a wonderful spot to enjoy some leisurely moments. It's an ideal place for relaxation and taking in the local culture.
name: Homenaje a las Hogueras de San Juan
address: Pl. Prta del Mar, 579, 03002 Alicante, Spain

excerpt: Popular, long-running market with vendors selling produce, seafood & meats, plus cheeses & breads.
detail_description: Mercat Central d'Alacant is a lively and historic market situated in the heart of Alicante. Dating back to the early 20th century, this bustling marketplace offers an array of local produce, meats, seafood, cheeses, and artisanal goods. The market is a cultural hub where locals and tourists gather to shop for fresh ingredients, savor traditional flavors, and immerse themselves in Alicante's culinary heritage.
name: Mercat Central d'Alacant
address: Av. Alfonso El Sabio, nº 10, 03004 Alacant, Alicante, Spain

detail_description: Plaza de los Luceros is a bustling public square located in the heart of Alicante, Spain. It serves as a popular meeting spot for both locals and visitors, offering an array of shops, eateries, and cafes. The square is flanked by significant historical landmarks such as the Alicante City Hall and the Basilica of Santa Maria.
name: Placa de los Luceros
address: Alacant, Spain

excerpt: A 45m-high blue cupola tops this austere 1600s cathedral, plus a baroque chapel & elegant cloisters.
detail_description: The Catedral de Sant Nicolau de Bari d'Alacant, also known as the Cathedral of St. Nicholas of Bari, is a stunning example of Gothic architecture located in Alicante's historic Old Town. This 17th-century cathedral boasts a 45m-high blue cupola and features a baroque chapel and elegant cloisters.
name: Cocatedral de Sant Nicolau de Bari d'Alacant
address: Plaza de, Pl. del Abad Penalva, 2, 03002 Alicante, Spain

excerpt: Museum with historical displays & objects relating to city's famed Bonfires of St. John festival.
detail_description: The Bonfire Museum, located in Alicante, Spain, is a celebration of the city's vibrant cultural tradition of Hogueras de San Juan (Bonfires of Saint John). The museum showcases historical displays and objects related to the annual festival, including elaborate sculptures, costumes, and memorabilia. Visitors can immerse themselves in the folklore and artistic heritage of Alicante through interactive exhibits that highlight the creativity and community spirit behind this iconic celebration.
name: Museu de les Fogueres
address: Rbla. de Méndez Núñez, 29, 03002 Alacant, Alicante, Spain

excerpt: Playa de San Juan is a lively beachfront neighborhood named after its busy stretch of white sand, lined with seafood restaurants and outdoor beach bars. Discos, karaoke parlors, and pubs draw crowds to Niza and Costa Blanca avenues at night. Shopping malls offer upscale beachwear boutiques, and central streets are filled with food market stalls on Saturday mornings. The area is popular for golf and water sports.
detail_description: Playa de San Juan is a vibrant beachfront area known for its bustling white sand stretch, adorned with seafood eateries and open-air beach bars. At night, Niza and Costa Blanca avenues come alive with discos, karaoke spots, and pubs. Upscale beachwear boutiques can be found in shopping malls while the central streets host food market stalls on Saturday mornings. This popular spot offers opportunities for golfing and various water sports.
name: San Juan Playa
address: Alicante, Spain

detail_description: Sip and Wonder Coffee House is a charming café located near the central market of Alacant. It prides itself on serving dishes made with care and passion, using fresh, locally sourced ingredients. The café offers a delightful dining experience with a menu that includes delicious breakfast options and expertly crafted coffee. Visitors love the cozy interior, friendly staff, and welcoming atmosphere, making it an ideal spot for relaxation or remote work.
name: Sip and Wonder Coffee House
address: Carrer Poeta Campos Vasallo, 8, 03004 Alacant, Alicante, Spain

excerpt: Bustling destination for Spanish tapas, beer & wine amid wood accents & a decorative tile floor.
detail_description: Manero Alicante - Manero Mollá is a vibrant destination in the heart of Alicante, offering a delightful experience for locals and tourists. The restaurant boasts an impressive display of locally caught seafood, vintage wines, and fresh produce. The elaborate floral mosaic floors and wood accents create an inviting atmosphere. With a menu featuring classic Mediterranean dishes and modern creations, there's something to satisfy every palate. Guests rave about the attentive and professional staff who provide exceptional service.
name: Manero Alicante - Manero Mollá
address: C. Médico Manero Mollà, 7, 03001 Alicante, Spain

detail_description: El Carrer dels Bolets is a charming street in Alicante adorned with whimsical mushroom sculptures, making it a unique and picturesque spot for leisurely strolls and photo opportunities. The bustling street is lined with various dining establishments, creating a lively atmosphere day and night. Visitors can also enjoy the nearby Placa Gabriel Miro, a serene green oasis located at the end of the street.
name: El Carrer dels Bolets
address: C. San Francisco, 30, 03001 Alacant, Alicante, Spain

detail_description: Alicante Golf is a stunning 18-hole course located on the beautiful San Juan beach, just minutes away from Alicante city. The course is known for its environmental focus and has received prestigious environmental quality certificates. Designed by Severiano Ballesteros, it features a unique layout with an equal number of par 3, par 4, and par 5 holes, offering players a varied and enjoyable game.
name: Alicante Golf
address: Av. del Locutor Vicente Hipólito, 37, 03540 Alicante, Spain

detail_description: Alicante Town Hall Square is a historic site in the heart of Alicante, featuring the impressive Concatedral de San Nicolas de Bari and the 18th-century baroque town hall building. The square is known for its charming pedestrian area and nearby attractions like Postiguet beach and Explanada de Alicante. On Sundays, visitors can explore small stalls selling various items under the arcades.
name: Alacant town hall square
address: Plaça de l'Ajuntament, 03002 Alacant, Alicante, Spain

detail_description: Alicante Marina is a vibrant nightlife hub that comes alive after the bars close, offering an array of Latina music clubs, nightclubs, and chill-out bars. Popular spots like Marmarela with its dual terraces featuring different music vibes, Samoa serving everything from cocktails to breakfast, and Bar Cayote providing lunch with a view of the port draw in crowds.
name: Alicante Marina
address: Lg, Mlle. Levante, 4B, 03002 Alicante, Spain

detail_description: Club Deportivo Puerto de Alicante is a modern harbor that offers a rich maritime experience and stunning coastal views. Originally a fishing port, it has evolved into a bustling marina with over 740 mooring places for vessels of all sizes. Visitors can enjoy leisurely strolls while admiring the yachts and stop at one of the many waterfront restaurants for a meal or drink. The area also provides an ideal setting for water sports, with professional instructors and a great atmosphere.
name: Club Deportivo Puerto de Alicante
address: Lugar Zona, Muelle Pte., 29A, 03003 Alicante, Spain

detail_description: Alicante Tasting Club offers an authentic experience of Spanish cuisine, particularly the beloved tapas. The club takes you away from touristy spots to where locals dine, ensuring a genuine culinary adventure. Visitors can also enjoy cooking classes with friendly chefs and explore the Mercado Central for delightful tastings and wine. The knowledgeable guides provide insights into Alicante's history while showcasing local wines and traditional food, making it a top choice for food enthusiasts looking to savor the best of Alicante.
name: Alicante Tasting Club - The #1 in food experiences and tours in Alicante
address: C. Santo Tomás, 9, 03002 Alicante, Spain

detail_description: C. Dean Zaragoza, 2 invites you to explore the enchanting neighborhood of Santa Cruz in Alicante, Spain. Nestled at the base of Mount Benacantil and adjacent to the historic Santa Barbara Castle, this area is a treasure trove of traditional charm. As you stroll through its lively streets, you'll be captivated by the stunning white houses adorned with vibrant tiles and unique friezes that tell their own stories.
name: C. Dean Zaragoza, 2
address: 03002 Alicante (Alacant), Alicante, Spain

excerpt: Iconic waterside promenade featuring a wave-patterned mosaic walkway with palm trees on either side.
detail_description: Passeig Esplanada d'Espanya, also known as the Explanada, is a charming waterfront promenade in Alicante, Spain. This picturesque walkway is adorned with a mesmerizing wave-patterned mosaic and flanked by elegant palm trees, creating a delightful setting for leisurely strolls and admiring the stunning views of the Mediterranean Sea. The vibrant atmosphere along the Explanada includes bustling cafes, inviting shops, and lively street performers.
name: Passeig Esplanada d'Espanya
address: Alacant, Spain

excerpt: Host to parades & events, this street lined with eateries & shops links the city centre to the port.
detail_description: Rbla. de Méndez Núñez is a bustling urban promenade that serves as a link between the city center and the port, hosting parades and events. Lined with shops, eateries, and stylish cafes, this charming boulevard dates back to the 19th century and is adorned with towering trees and vibrant flowers. It's a popular spot for leisurely strolls, window shopping, and people-watching.
name: Rbla. de Méndez Núñez
address: Alicante (Alacant), Alicante, Spain

detail_description: Marina Esportiva del Port d'Alacant is a vibrant and lively area that comes alive at night, with bars and nightclubs staying open until 4 am. The marina offers a mix of chill-out bars, Latin music clubs, and popular spots like Marmarela with its two terraces playing various music genres. Additionally, Soho Mar provides stunning views of the port while serving breakfasts and delicious cocktails.
name: Marina Deportiva del Puerto de Alicante
address: Muelle 8 Zona de Levante, s/n, 03001 Alicante, Spain

detail_description: The Ascensor del Castillo de Santa Bárbara in Alicante is a fantastic way to reach the historic fortress without the strenuous climb. This smooth and quick elevator ride transports visitors directly to the summit of Mount Benacantil, where they are greeted with stunning panoramic views of Alicante's cityscape, coastline, and the shimmering Mediterranean Sea. The experience is not only scenic but also budget-friendly, as accessing both the castle and elevator is free.
name: Ascensor del Castillo de Santa Bárbara
address: Avinguda Juan Bautista Lafora, 03002 Alacant, Alicante, Spain

excerpt: Fine sand beach sheltered from the north wind & surrounded by hotels, shops & dining options.
detail_description: Playa de la Almadraba is a fine sand beach located just a few minutes from Alicante's city center. It is nestled between the Cala de los Judios and Playa de la Albufereta, offering a tranquil escape from the bustling city. This semi-urban beach spans 750 meters in length and 6 meters in width, providing ample space for relaxation and sunbathing.
name: Playa de la Almadraba
address: Spain

detail_description: The Museo Taurino, located next to the Plaza de Toros in Alicante, Spain, is a museum dedicated to bullfighting. It offers a permanent exhibition on the history and heritage of this well-known Spanish tradition. The museum also hosts film screenings and talks about the world of bullfighting.
name: Museo Taurino
address: Plaza Sta. Teresa, 3, 03004 Alicante, Spain

name: Museu de Betlems
address: C/ de Sant Agustí, 3, 03002 Alacant, Alicante, Spain

detail_description: Parc Canalejas is a well-known and popular park located near the Esplanada d'Espanya. It is characterized by its ancient ficus trees that provide shade along the promenade. The park features modern and fresh decor, with a welcoming atmosphere and beautiful views of the sea. Visitors can enjoy the peaceful ambiance, as well as engage in recreational activities such as children's games and sports.
name: Parc Canalejas
address: Av. de Ramón y Cajal, 6, 03003 Alacant, Alicante, Spain

excerpt: Built in 2009, this casino offers card games & slot machines, plus 2 restaurants & an art gallery
detail_description: The Casino Mediterrani Alacant, established in 2009, provides a variety of card games and slot machines. It also features two restaurants and an art gallery for entertainment. Previously located in Torrevieja, it has now been relocated to the Zenia Boulevard Shopping Centre. The ambiance inside is dimly lit, but the staff members are friendly and welcoming. Non-residents require a passport for entry. While they offer a poker game, their slot machines are outdated.
name: Casino Mediterráneo | Alicante
address: Marina Deportiva, Mlle. Levante, 03002 Alacant, Alicante, Spain

detail_description: The Museum of Illusions Alicante, located in Canelejas park, offers a captivating experience filled with mind-bending exhibits and optical illusions. Visitors can expect to be immersed in a world where reality is twisted and turned upside down, providing ample opportunities for fun and unique photo moments. The museum features an array of interactive exhibitions that cater to both adults and children, making it an ideal destination for families. Additionally, the museum showcases historical and scientific displays, adding an educational element to the experience.
name: Museo de las ilusiones Alicante
address: Av. de Ramón y Cajal, 8, 03003 Alicante, Spain

name: Monumento a Canalejas
address: Passeig Esplanada d'Espanya, 45, 03001 Alicante, Spain

name: Tablao Flamenco La Guitarreria
address: C. Mayor, 16, 03002 Alicante, Spain

excerpt: Remains of an early-19th-century castle, now serving as a lookout point with expansive city views.
detail_description: San Fernando's Castle, although not a traditional castle, is an early-19th-century fortress that offers stunning city views. Originally intended as a military fortification, it never saw battle due to the French retreating before engaging in war. The site features cannons, a palace, dungeons, and a moat alongside panoramic views of Alicante and the coast. Accessible by lift from the beach near Marina tram stop, it also offers peaceful exploration with free entry.
name: Castillo de San Fernando
address: Mont Tossal, 03005 Alacant, Spain

excerpt: Complex of structures comprising a nuns' monastery with a noteworthy, original 16th-century tower.
detail_description: Nestled just 5 kilometers north of Alicante, the Santa Faz Monastery is a captivating blend of history and spirituality. This stunning complex features a remarkable 16th-century tower and an exquisite Baroque-style church that showcases intricate architectural details. The monastery is situated in the quaint village of Santa Faz, known for its annual Easter pilgrimage that draws visitors from far and wide. While exploring this serene site, you can admire the peaceful surroundings perfect for reflection or prayer.
name: Santa Faz Monastery, Alicante
address: C. Mayor, 2, 03559 Santa Faz, Alicante, Spain

name: Passeig de Federico Soto
address: Av. de Federico Soto, 03003 Alicante, Spain

detail_description: Estadi José Rico Pérez is the home stadium of Hercules CF, offering a unique experience for football enthusiasts. The stadium has a rich history and provides an impressive ambiance. Visitors can explore the club shop and enjoy the friendly service from locals. With excellent accessibility and great views of the pitch, it's a great place to catch a match and immerse yourself in the exciting atmosphere created by the passionate fans.
name: Estadio José Rico Pérez
address: C. Foguerer José Romeu, 10, 03005 Alacant, Alicante, Spain
